cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW, then NW and north into the eastern Gulf before recurving northeast across Florida’s Big Bend toward the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend), then southeastern U.S. Atlantic coast from Georgia through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible late Tuesday–Wednesday from outer bands; sustained tropical‐storm-force winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises (<1 ft) possible along southeast Louisiana coast; significant surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–2 inches of rain through Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Higher seas and swells in the Gulf may hamper vessel movements and offshore operations
